developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'trickle_fsync_interval_in_kb' is used in the code to determine when to perform a file system sync operation (fsync) based on the position of the file write pointer. The fsync operation is triggered when the position exceeds the last sync position plus the configured interval in kilobytes multiplied by 1024 bytes.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'trickle_fsync_interval_in_kb' configuration depends on the rate of file writes and the position of the write pointer. If the position exceeds the last sync position plus the configured interval, the fsync operation is triggered.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'trickle_fsync_interval_in_kb' configuration option is to control the frequency of file system sync operations during write operations. A smaller interval may result in more frequent sync operations, potentially impacting performance but ensuring data durability. On the other hand, a larger interval may reduce the frequency of sync operations, improving performance but potentially increasing the risk of data loss in case of a system failure.
